title: What Are Graduate Labor Unions and How Do They Work?
content: The first graduate labor union was formed at the University of Wisconsinâ€“Madison in 1970. While graduate labor union numbers have been slowly increasing since then, there has recently been a huge jump in unionizing efforts in the U.S. beginning in 2020, at the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. The chaos of the pandemic and the intervening economic inflation and upheaval brought to light the poor treatment of graduate workers. Workers were told they were essential and were made to return to work but were not given proper PPE (Andrews et al. 2020), and a survey from 2020 found that more than 25% of graduate students suffered from food or housing insecurity (Ogilvie et al. 2020).
